publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2521 Donald Gorrie: First-time House Purchasers—That the Parliament urges the Scottish Executive to press the Chancellor of the Exchequer to raise the threshold at which house-buyers have to pay stamp duty from £60,000, the figure that it has been since 1993, to the equivalent related figure for current house prices, estimated to be £156,000; notes that 59% of Scottish first-time buyers now pay stamp duty compared to virtually none in the 1990s, and believes that this change would help new first-time buyers to enter the housing market.

S2M-2521 Donald Gorrie: First-time House Purchasers—That the Parliament urges the Scottish Executive to press the Chancellor of the Exchequer to raise the threshold at which house-buyers have to pay stamp duty from £60,000, the figure that it has been since 1993, to the equivalent related figure for current house prices, estimated to be £156,000; notes that 59% of Scottish first-time buyers now pay stamp duty compared to virtually none in the 1990s, and believes that this change would help new first-time buyers to enter the housing market.
S2M-2521 First-time House Purchasers (lodged on 3 March 2005) Mike Rumbles*
S2M-2521 First-time House Purchasers (lodged on 3 March 2005) Margaret Smith*, Mike Pringle*, John Farquhar Munro*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-2521 First-time House Purchasers (lodged on 3 March 2005) Ms Sandra White*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, George Lyon*, Robert Brown*
S2M-2521 First-time House Purchasers (lodged on 3 March 2005) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-2521 First-time House Purchasers (lodged on 3 March 2005) John Swinburne*
S2M-2521 First-time House Purchasers (lodged on 3 March 2005) Elaine Smith*
S2M-2521 First-time House Purchasers (lodged on 3 March 2005) Robin Harper*
